descriptors.defaultMessage: At certain times during the mission, you may be able to complete Research and Development reports. These reports allow you to upgrade, improve, and activate ship systems.
If a research and development report hasn't been calculated, you need to request a report by clicking on this button.
When a system may be upgraded, instructions to perform the upgrade will appear here. Follow them exactly.

Sometimes, a system needs a reactivation code to be entered before it can be upgraded. Click the 'Enter Reactivation Code' button, then press the symbols listed in your upgrade report. Once the reactivation code is accepted, the report will be complete.

The ship’s systems are intelligent enough to know when they’re damaged, and to understand (mostly) how they can be fixed. A list of damaged systems appears here. Click a system to see the damage report
If a damage report hasn't been calculated, you need to request a damage report by clicking on this button.
When a system is damaged, instructions to troubleshoot and repair the damaged system will appear here. Follow them exactly.

Sometimes, a system needs a reactivation code to be entered before it can be repaired. Click the 'Enter Reactivation Code' button, then press the symbols listed in your damage report. Once the reactivation code is accepted, the system will be repaired.
Available R&D Reports
descriptors.description: Below this header is a list of available research and development reports

descriptors.defaultMessage: Damaged Systems
descriptors.description: Below this header is a list of damaged system repair reports

descriptors.defaultMessage: Cancel
descriptors.description: A button to stop entering a reactivation code

descriptors.defaultMessage: Clear
descriptors.description: A button to clear the reactivation code input

descriptors.defaultMessage: Reactivate
descriptors.description: A button to confirm the entered reactivation code and begin the reactivation process

descriptors.defaultMessage: Request Damage Report
descriptors.description: A button to request a repair report for a damaged system

descriptors.defaultMessage: R&D Report
descriptors.description: A header for the research & development report readout

descriptors.defaultMessage: Damage Report
descriptors.description: A header for the damage report readout

descriptors.defaultMessage: Previous Step
descriptors.description: A button to go to the previous step

descriptors.defaultMessage: Verifying Step
descriptors.description: A message indicating that the damage report step is currently being verified

descriptors.defaultMessage: Verify Step
descriptors.description: A button to initiate verification of the damage report step to ensure it was completed correctly

descriptors.defaultMessage: Next Step
descriptors.description: A button to go to the next step

descriptors.defaultMessage: This alert condition is used when the ship is in danger or under attack. All crew members are put on duty at battle stations.
This alert condition is used when the ship is in a dangerous situation, but is safe for the moment. All crew members are put on duty.
This alert condition is used when the ship needs to be ready for a crisis. All off duty personnel are put on stand by status.
This alert condition is used when the station has a minor problem. All crew except damage control is on standard duty.
This alert condition is used when the ship is at normal running status. The crew is on standard duty and the ship is in no danger.
Alert Condition
